title: User Onboarding Flow
author: Builder A
specContent: Create an async onboarding flow where users can complete profile setup at their own pace. The system saves progress automatically. Users receive an email summary after each session. No real-time validation required—all checks happen on submit.

executability.rationale: Clear intent with step-by-step UX flow. Explicit acceptance criteria for each onboarding stage. Minor gap: no explicit error states for invalid email format.

constraintPrecision.rationale: Uses testable language ('saves automatically', 'on submit'). Defined defaults for optional fields. Small ambiguity in 'email summary' timing.

reviewDiscipline.rationale: Includes guardrails for async behavior. Test scenarios cover happy path and session timeout. Missing: multi-device sync test case.

cultureAlignment.rationale: Fully async design. No sync dependencies. Progress saved without real-time connection. Perfect alignment with Async-First principle.

benchmarkAmbition.rationale: Exceeds competitor baseline. Email summaries and progress persistence are 100x better than typical 'complete in one session' flows.

runs.notes: Clean first run. Agent understood intent immediately.

title: Payment Integration
author: Builder B
specContent: Add Stripe payment processing to checkout. Users should be able to pay with credit card. Show success or error message after payment.

executability.rationale: Basic intent is clear but lacks step-by-step flow. No mention of loading states, retry logic, or partial failures. 'Show success or error' is too vague.

constraintPrecision.rationale: Missing defaults for timeout, currency, and region. 'Credit card' doesn't specify card types supported. No constraints on amount limits.

reviewDiscipline.rationale: No test scenarios provided. No mention of how to verify in review. Missing guardrails for PCI compliance considerations.

cultureAlignment.rationale: Mostly async-friendly. Minor concern: spec doesn't clarify if confirmation requires sync polling or webhook.

benchmarkAmbition.rationale: Standard payment flow. Meets baseline but doesn't push for 100x experience.

specDeltas.suggestion: Specify supported card types: Visa, Mastercard, Amex. Define behavior for declined cards: show specific error message with retry option.
Add edge cases section: network timeout (retry after 3s, max 3 attempts), insufficient funds, expired card, 3D Secure flow.
Add: 'Payment webhook updates order status within 30 seconds. User sees confirmation without refreshing.'

runs.notes: First run had missing error handling. Two clarification rounds needed.

title: Dashboard Analytics
author: Builder A
specContent: Create a dashboard showing key metrics: total users, active sessions, and revenue. Data should update regularly. Include date range picker for filtering. Charts should be responsive.

executability.rationale: Good structure with clear metrics list. 'Update regularly' is ambiguous—could mean real-time, hourly, or daily. Date picker behavior not fully specified.

constraintPrecision.rationale: 'Responsive' lacks breakpoint definitions. No default date range specified. Missing: what happens when no data exists for selected range.

reviewDiscipline.rationale: Implicit review via 'charts should be responsive' but no specific test scenarios. Missing: performance expectations for large datasets.

cultureAlignment.rationale: Dashboard design is async-friendly. Data updates don't require user action. Minor: 'regularly' could imply polling which may have sync undertones.

benchmarkAmbition.rationale: Standard dashboard with good basics. Date picker and responsiveness are table stakes but well-requested.

specDeltas.suggestion: Replace with: 'Data refreshes every 5 minutes via background fetch. User can manually refresh. Last updated timestamp shown.'
Define breakpoints: Mobile (<640px) shows stacked cards. Tablet (640-1024px) shows 2-column grid. Desktop (>1024px) shows full dashboard.

runs.notes: First run needed clarification on update frequency.

title: Notification System
author: Builder C
specContent: Build a notification system. Users should get notified when things happen. Support push notifications, email, and in-app. Schedule a meeting with the team to discuss priority levels.

executability.rationale: Extremely vague: 'when things happen' provides no actionable trigger list. No user flow described. Scope is undefined—could take weeks or months.

constraintPrecision.rationale: No constraints on notification frequency, quiet hours, or user preferences. 'Support push, email, in-app' doesn't define fallback order or delivery guarantees.

reviewDiscipline.rationale: No acceptance criteria. No test scenarios. No guardrails. Impossible to verify completion.

cultureAlignment.rationale: CRITICAL VIOLATION: 'Schedule a meeting' directly contradicts Async-First culture. This spec forces synchronous coordination.

benchmarkAmbition.rationale: Multi-channel notifications are ambitious but spec is too vague to assess against benchmark.

cultureViolations.quote: Schedule a meeting with the team to discuss priority levels
cultureViolations.suggestion: Replace with: 'Document proposed priority levels in this spec. Request async feedback via comments. Finalize based on written input within 48 hours.'

specDeltas.suggestion: Create explicit trigger list: Order placed, Order shipped, Payment failed, New message received, Weekly digest. Each trigger maps to specific channels.
Add: 'User can toggle each notification type. Quiet hours (10pm-8am user local time) delay non-urgent notifications. Delivery confirmation logged for audit.'
Remove synchronous dependency. Document decisions in spec.

runs.notes: Multiple clarification rounds. Agent struggled with undefined scope.

title: Search Feature
author: Builder B
specContent: Implement full-text search across all content. Search results appear as user types (debounced 300ms). Results grouped by type: Documents, Users, Projects. Empty state shows recent searches. Max 20 results per type. Keyboard navigation supported (arrow keys + enter).

executability.rationale: Excellent specificity: debounce timing, grouping structure, result limits all defined. Keyboard nav requirement is clear. Minor gap: no loading state description.

constraintPrecision.rationale: Precise constraints: 300ms debounce, 20 results max, specific keys for navigation. Empty state defined. Only gap: no mention of fuzzy matching tolerance.

reviewDiscipline.rationale: Implicit test scenarios via keyboard nav requirement. Missing: explicit performance expectation (e.g., results in <200ms).

cultureAlignment.rationale: Perfect async design. Client-side debouncing. No sync dependencies. Embodies Search-First culture principle.

benchmarkAmbition.rationale: Solid search implementation. Keyboard nav is great. Could push further with filters, saved searches, or AI-powered suggestions.

specDeltas.suggestion: Add: 'Search results render within 200ms of debounce completion. Skeleton loading shown during fetch.'

runs.notes: Spec was clear enough for single-run completion.
